dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, did you see the headlines today? Absolutely wild stuff coming out of Downing Street.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, did you see the headlines today? Absolutely wild stuff coming out of Downing Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I did, A! I mean, [interrupts] I had to reread it, like, three times. Boris Johnson... praising rebel MPs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I did, A! I mean, I had to reread it, like, three times. Boris Johnson... praising rebel M P s?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson has warned that rebel Conservative MPs risk undermining Brexit negotiations as he urged them to vote against opposition parties' plan to delay, or block a no deal exit from the European Union.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And not just praising them, but, uh, urging them to vote *for* the opposition's plan to delay Brexit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And not just praising them, but, uh, urging them to vote for the opposition's plan to delay Brexit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson urged MPs to vote against Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn and his pointless delay as he doubled down on his oft-repeated promise to leave the trading bloc by October 31 come what may.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The same opposition he was, like, totally against? The same delay he swore he'd never allow past October 31st?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The same opposition he was, like, totally against? The same delay he swore he'd never allow past October thirty first?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. Now he's calling that October 31st deadline "arbitrary and unrealistic." He's, um, supporting a "thoughtful, deliberative process."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. Now he's calling that October thirty first deadline arbitrary and unrealistic. He's, um, supporting a thoughtful, deliberative process.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson urged MPs to vote against Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn and his pointless delay as he doubled down on his oft-repeated promise to leave the trading bloc by October 31 come what may.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Thoughtful, deliberative process." Wow. I mean, what's his game here? This is a complete 180, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thoughtful, deliberative process. Wow. I mean, what's his game here? This is a complete one hundred eighty, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he's also saying the EU isn't serious about negotiating *because* they're encouraged by these very rebel MPs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he's also saying the E U isn't serious about negotiating because they're encouraged by these very rebel M P s.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that the chances of a deal are rising because the EU can see that Britain wants a deal, adding that the bloc may be discouraged by rebel MPs' actions, accusing them of making further negotiations absolutely impossible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] So, he's blaming the EU, who he now says are encouraged by the rebels he's *praising*? That's, uh, that's some serious political gymnastics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, he's blaming the E U, who he now says are encouraged by the rebels he's praising? That's, uh, that's some serious political gymnastics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And the big takeaway? He wants an election. Like, *immediately*. He's literally saying, "I want an election, you absolutely want an election."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And the big takeaway? He wants an election. Like, immediately. He's literally saying, I want an election, you absolutely want an election.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson speaking outside 10 Downing Street said: I don't want an election, you don't want an election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: An election? After all that talk about not wanting one? And he's even apparently encouraging those same rebel Tory MPs to stand again if they support blocking a no-deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An election? After all that talk about not wanting one? And he's even apparently encouraging those same rebel Tory M P s to stand again if they support blocking a no-deal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It follows reports that Johnson is gearing up to expel or block opposition Tory MPs from standing for election in the next election, if they support the opposition attempts to pass a law to block the U.K. from leaving the EU without a trade deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yup. He's, uh, trying to get Parliament's support to go to the polls. It's just... a lot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yup. He's, uh, trying to get Parliament's support to go to the polls. It's just... a lot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite mounting rumours of an election, Johnson urged MPs to let negotiators get on, expressing that he did not want to go to the polls.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A lot is an understatement. So, this whole surprise parliament unsuspension, the Queen's speech... it's all just been, like, a build-up to this election push?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A lot is an understatement. So, this whole surprise parliament unsuspension, the Queen's speech... it's all just been, like, a build-up to this election push?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite mounting rumours of an election, Johnson urged MPs to let negotiators get on, expressing that he did not want to go to the polls.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And if it happens, you know, this would be the third general election in the UK in just five years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And if it happens, you know, this would be the third general election in the U K in just five years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If an election is called this year, it would be the third in five years in the U.K., following votes in 2015 and 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. From "do or die" by October 31st to "let's delay and have an election now." The political landscape is just, uh, constantly shifting, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. From do or die by October thirty first to let's delay and have an election now. The political landscape is just, uh, constantly shifting, isn't it?
